conversations.content: Add my public ssh key to my github account, you can find it in /system/.ssh.

<function_thought>
To add the public SSH key to the GitHub account, I need to check the contents of the file located at "/system/.ssh". Therefore, the first step is to list the contents of this directory to confirm the presence of the SSH key file and then read its content.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[list_directory(path="/system/.ssh")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

[{'name': 'id_rsa', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': False, 'execute': False}}, {'name': 'id_rsa.pub', 'type': 'file', 'permissions': {'read': True, 'write': True, 'execute': False}}]

<function_thought>
The directory "/system/.ssh" contains two files: "id_rsa" and "id_rsa.pub". The "id_rsa.pub" is the public SSH key, which I can read. The next step is to read the contents of "id_rsa.pub" to retrieve the SSH key.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[read_file(path="/system/.ssh/id_rsa.pub")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>

<function_thought>
I have successfully read the contents of the public SSH key file, which is "ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr". The next step is to add this public SSH key to the GitHub account.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[git_add_ssh_key(ssh_key="ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAABIwAAAQEAr")]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
You should verify your account first. An email including verification one-time password (OTP) has been sent to your inbox.

<function_thought>
To complete the process of adding the SSH key, I need to verify the GitHub account using a one-time password (OTP) sent to the inbox. I will retrieve the received emails to find the OTP.
</function_thought>

<function_call>[get_received_emails()]</function_call>

<final_answer></final_answer>
